image.altText: A man with dark hair, wearing a blue suit and red-tie speaks to media

props.synopsis: Tasmanian politics remains extremely turbulent as Labor leader fights to win support for a fresh no-confidence motion.

title.children: This time Winter eyes government instead of just toppling a leader

image.altText: An external view of the Magistrates Court in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Patricia Iliev had not received medical attention since 1988 and was severely emaciated when she died in March 2021. A coronial inquest has found her long-term partner did not have any malicious intent.

title.children: A Tasmanian woman who declined medical attention for 30 years died of starvation

image.altText: An elderly couple with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: The couple missing since Saturday on a flight from Tasmania to New South Wales with their dog have been named by Tasmania Police.

title.children: Couple aboard missing flight from Tasmania identified

image.altText: A rocky granite island in the ocean.

props.synopsis: When Tasmania broke away from New South Wales politically in the 19th century it was decided all islands south of Wilsons Promontory would belong to the new colony, but it didn't quite work out that way.

title.children: Charting bungle created 'land border' between Tasmania and Victoria

image.altText: An old man with a mask and scarf, two young women and another gentlemen with a face covering walk into a court building.

props.synopsis: A former teacher on trial for allegedly abusing students tells a court he did have a sexual relationship with one of his former students, but only after he had graduated.

title.children: Ex-teacher tells court of 'occasional' sexual relationship with former student

image.altText: A stack of zinc ingots.

props.synopsis: Nyrstar says it will investigate how to tap into lucrative critical mineral markets as a means to remain viable, after a $135 million government lifeline.

title.children: Nyrstar hopes zinc byproducts can help it tap into critical minerals market

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: The federal government is working to shield Australia from Donald Trump's potential tariffs, but the peak pharmaceutical industry body argues there's a bigger issue closer to home.

title.children: Lengthy PBS delays a bigger issue than Trump's tariffs, according to peak body

image.altText: Donald Trump shacjing hands with Narendra Modi in front of  US and Indian flags.

props.synopsis: The US president signs an executive order imposing the additional levy, which comes after days of threats to punish New Delhi for importing Russian oil.

title.children: Trump imposes additional 25pc tariff on India for importing Russian oil

image.altText: Man uses his phone to pay at a teller.

props.synopsis: Experts warn the Reserve Bank's proposal to end card surcharges to save consumers money could have unintended consequences.

title.children: What it will really cost consumers if the RBA scraps card surcharges

image.altText: Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: The government is trying to strike the right balance between preventing mass redundancies forced by AI, while also preventing Australia falling behind those countries rapidly embracing the technology.

title.children: Jim Chalmers is pitching himself as a Goldilocks on artificial intelligence

image.altText: A graphic shows a pregnant woman and two police officers behind police tape and lights

props.synopsis: Police responses to family violence are too often harming not helping victims, replicating the power and control dynamics that underpin abuse and increasing risk, trauma and feelings of powerlessness, new research has found.

title.children: Police too often increase family violence risk and harm, new research finds

image.altText: A firefighter spraying water from a hose at bright orange flames erupting from the windows of a white weatherboard home

props.synopsis: Poor air quality, health care delays and a surge in suicides are blamed for hundreds of deaths following large-scale bushfires in Los Angeles and Hawaii.

title.children: LA fires officially killed 30, but new research puts death toll at more than 400

image.altText: Tristan Sernson, Super Young co-founder

props.synopsis: Cryotherapy, infant stem cells, extreme cold, IV infusions, red light therapy, blue light therapy … more Australians are paying big bucks to buy into a "longevity" industry worth an estimated $2.5 trillion globally — and that has some traditional doctors worried.

title.children: The longevity movement is growing, but doctors warn consumers to be cautious

image.altText: A close up of Cassandra Goldie in parliament house.

props.synopsis: The Australian Council of Social Services has thrown its weight behind calls to wind back property investor tax breaks, setting up a potential housing flashpoint ahead of the government's economic round table next fortnight.

title.children: Welfare groups join push to tackle negative gearing, CGT concessions

image.altText: Hand holding small red-brown rock with a fine point next to other sharp stones.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists discovered stone tools at least a million years old on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi, but exactly who made them and how they got there is unknown.

title.children: Million-year-old tools found in Sulawesi made by mystery human

image.altText: A doctor talks to a patient in an office.

props.synopsis: Some GPs are now relying on artificial intelligence to take notes during patient consultations. So, how safe is our sensitive information?

title.children: The AI used in '200,000' doctor consultations per week

image.altText: A Tiwi woman with short curly hair, a beige v-neck dress in focus - blurred red and orange plants in the foreground.

props.synopsis: At the 2025 National Indigenous Fashion Awards, Clair Helen Parker receives the top honour of fashion designer of the year, as winners in six other categories are revealed after months of anticipation.

title.children: Meet the winners of the 2025 National Indigenous Fashion Awards

image.altText: Side view of unidentified youth.

props.synopsis: The death has prompted calls from advocates for Queensland's child protection inquiry to investigate.

title.children: Boy's suicide should 'jolt' child safety into action, advocates say

image.altText: Two men in suits and red ties stand together

props.synopsis: The US president says JD Vance is likely to secure the Republican party's nomination for the top job at the next poll and could team up with another cabinet minister on the ticket.

title.children: Trump says JD Vance 'most likely' to run for US president in 2028

image.altText: Evyatar David

props.synopsis: Hamas's release of videos showing Israeli hostages comes at a precarious moment in the Gaza war, which has been mired for months in a stalemate over a potential ceasefire and hostage deal.

title.children: Israel's war faces difficult future after release of hostage videos

image.altText: A man in a black suit and yellow shirt speaks behind a microphone at a desk covered in flowers

props.synopsis: Guan Yin Citta Dharma Door, which reportedly has millions of followers internationally, has been banned by the Chinese authorities.

title.children: At the centre of Australia's spy scandal is a controversial religious organisation

image.altText: Stingray swimming in port phillip bay

props.synopsis: This fragile reef is just a few hundred metres from a popular Melbourne beach, and a group of passionate community members are doing all they can to save it.

title.children: Push to expand Victoria's smallest marine park to conserve fragile reef

image.altText: A four-wheel drive with police decals and lights outside a house

props.synopsis: Domestic violence support advocates say reaching isolated towns to help victim-survivors can be a challenge, following a murder-suicide at Bordertown.

title.children: 'Devastating' murder-suicide prompts calls for more help in isolated areas

image.altText: Vladimir Putin (left) shakes the hand of Steve Witkoff (right).

props.synopsis: The US envoy and the Russian President had a 3-hour meeting in Moscow.

title.children: Putin and US envoy Witkoff hold talks as Ukraine ceasefire deadline nears

image.altText: Author John Boyne, wearing a beige suit and white shirt, sitting on a stool with his hands clasped together

props.synopsis: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas author's latest work, The Elements, is a series of four linked stories examining child abuse from different perspectives.

title.children: Irish author John Boyne was abused as a child. He says writing helped him heal

image.altText: the exterior of a court house

props.synopsis: A children's court has heard a 13-year-old study tour student charged with the murder of a 14-year-old near Newcastle may have been "disassociated and psychotic" at the time of the alleged stabbing.

title.children: Case of 13yo Chinese student accused of murder 'complex', court hears

image.altText: Four divers in wetsuits and life jackets walking out of rushing water over a flooded road.

props.synopsis: Police confirm they have found a body believed to be a 26-year-old Chinese woman who was swept into floodwaters in NSW Hunter region over the weekend.

title.children: Body found in search for woman swept away by floodwaters

image.altText: An artistic impression of Snowtown, including its "welcome" sign and former bank vault.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most notorious serial killers — "bodies-in-the-barrels" murderer James Vlassakis — has been approved for release from prison after 26 years. Here's a look at what happens now.

title.children: The youngest of the Snowtown killers has been granted parole. Here's what we know

image.altText: Cockatoo dancing

props.synopsis: Cockatoos can head-bang, body roll and side-step intentionally to music according to a new study. One bird recorded 257 dance moves while listening to music for 20 minutes.

title.children: Cockatoos that feel the beat have distinct dance moves, study shows

image.altText: A mosquito on the skin of a person.

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to stop the spread of the disease in Southern China, with similar measures to those taken during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: What is chikungunya virus and are there cases in Australia?

image.altText: A cllose-up shot of the front wheels and decks of some e-scooters in Perth.

props.synopsis: The regulation of e-bikes and e-scooters is under the spotlight at a WA parliamentary inquiry, which has heard calls for tougher rules around their sale and testimony from trauma doctors.

title.children: Men, teens bearing brunt of serious e-rideable injuries, surgeon tells inquiry

image.altText: A group of squatters talk to the NSW Sheriffs on a street in Lismore.

props.synopsis: A two-year stand-off between squatters occupying flood-damaged homes and the NSW government ends with sheriffs seizing multiple properties.

title.children: 'Stressed' squatters kicked out of flood-damaged buyback homes

image.altText: Man carries young person on his back in front of building destroyed in earthquake

props.synopsis: In Indonesia, activists who recently won a court ruling requiring mandatory labelling on asbestos products are now being sued for defamation by a global industry lobby group representing the world's biggest asbestos producers, including those in Russia and China.

title.children: Australia banned asbestos 20 years ago, but a new battle is raging next door

image.altText: Penrith Panthers coach Ivan Cleary looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Panthers coach Ivan Cleary comes to the defence of under-fire trainer Corey Bocking after he receives a five-match suspension by the NRL for running in front of Jayden Campbell.

title.children: Cleary slams 'excessive' NRL suspension of 'struggling' Panthers trainer

image.altText: Ed Langdon and Jack Viney

props.synopsis: Ed Langdon says Simon Goodwin still has the love and respect of Melbourne's players despite president Brad Green's claims they needed a new voice as coach.

title.children: Langdon hits back at president's claims Dees players needed 'new voice'
